string.text: U 885 hodzie n.e. Armianie adnavili siabie jak suvierennaje haspadarstva pad kiraŭnictvam Ašota I z dynastyi Bahratydaŭ. Značnaja častka Armianskaj šlachty i sialanstva biehła ad Bizantyjskaj akupacyi Bahratydskaj Armienii ŭ 1045 hodzie i nastupnaha ŭvarvańnia ŭ kraj Turkaŭ-Sieldžukaŭ u 1064 hodzie. Jany ŭ vialikaj kolkaści pasialilisia ŭ Kilikii, Anatalijskam krai, dzie Armianie byli mienšaściu jašče z Rymskich časoŭ. U 1080 hodzie jany zasnavali niezaležnaje Armianskaje Kniastva, potym Kilikijskaje Karaleŭstva, jakoje stała centram Armianskaha nacyjanalizmu. Armianie ŭstalavali ciesnyja sacyjalnyja, kulturnyja, vajskovyja i relihijnyja suviazi z blizkimi Haspadarstvami Kryžakoŭ, ale ŭ kančatkovym vyniku sastupili ŭvarvańniam Mamlukaŭ.

Orden byŭ zasnavany karalom Afonsu I u honar hrupy rycaraŭ ordena Śviatoha Jakava Miečnika z Karaleŭstva Leon, jakija dapamahli jamu adbić Santaren u Maŭraŭ na Fest Śviatoha Michaiła, 8 traŭnia 1147 hoda. Spačatku orden byŭ sfarmavany z čalcoŭ Vajskovaha Ordena Śviatoha Jakava.

Hibiert ci Vibiert Ravenski byŭ italjanskim prełatam, archibiskupam Ravenny. U 1080 hodzie jon byŭ abrany papam ŭ apazicyju da Papy Ryhora VII i ŭziaŭ imia Klimient III. Ryhor byŭ lidaram ruchu carkvy, jakoje vystupała suprać tradycyjnych damahańniaŭ Jeŭrapiejskich manarchaŭ na kantrol za carkoŭnymi pryznačeńniami. Suprać ruchu vystupali prychilniki manarchičnych pravoŭ na čale z Impierataram Śviatoj Rymskaj Impieryi. U vyniku adbyŭsia kanflikt, viadomy jak Sprečka Inviestytury. Na dumku mnohich, Ryhor zajšoŭ zadaloka, kali adłučyŭ Impieratara Śviatoj Rymskaj Impieryi Hienrycha IV i padtrymaŭ supiernika, jaki pretendavaŭ na impieratarski tytuł. U 1080 hodzie praimpierski Sinod u Bryksenie abviaściŭ, što Ryhor zrynuty i zamienieny na pastu papy Hibiertam.

Vajskovy orden Śviatoha Łazara Jerusalimskaha byŭ zasnavany ŭ špitali prakažonych u dvanaccatym stahodździ kryžakami Łacinskaha Karaleŭstva. Na Uschodzie isnavali bolš rańnija špitali prakažonych. Rycary Śviatoha Łazara pretendavali na ich, kab vyhladać bolš staražytnymi i vydać siabie za najstary z usich ordenaŭ. Spačatku Orden Śviatoha Łazara byŭ całkam u składzie ordena Špitaljeraŭ, i prytrymlivaŭsia špitalnaha praviła Śviatoha Aŭhuscina, jakoje vykarystoŭvałasia na Zachadzie. Ścviardžajecca, što ŭ 12 stahoddzi orden staŭ hrać vajskovuju rolu, ale heta nie paćviardžajecca pravieranymi dokazami. Łazary nasili zialony kryž na svajoj mantyi.

The Order of Assassins or simply the Assassins were a Nizari Ismailist order and sect of Shia Islam that existed between 1090 and 1275 CE, founded by Hasan-i Sabbah. During that time they lived in the mountains of Persia and in Syria, and held a strict subterfuge policy throughout the Middle East through the covert murder of Muslim and Christian leaders who were considered enemies of the Nizārī Ismaili State. The modern term assassination is believed to stem from the tactics used by the Assassins.

The Kingdom of Powys was a Welsh successor state, petty kingdom and principality that emerged during the Middle Ages following the end of Roman rule in Britain. It very roughly covered the northern two-thirds of the modern county of Powys and part of todays English West Midlands.

Orden Rycaraŭ Špitala Sviatoha Ijaana Jerusalimskaha, šyroka viadomyja jak Rycary-Špitaljery, byŭ siaredniaviečnym i rańnim dziejsnym Katalickim vajskovym ordenam. Jon byŭ zasnavany ŭ Jerusalimskim Karaleŭstvie ŭ XII stahodździ i mieŭ tam štab-kvateru da 1291 hoda. Arhanizacyja stała vajskova-relihijnym ordenam na padstavie ŭłasnaha papskaha statuta, u abaviazki ordena ŭvachodzili kłopaty i abarona Śviatoj Ziamli. Paśla zavajovy Sviatoj Ziamli Isłamskimi siłami rycary dziejali z vyspy Rodas, nad jakoj jany byli suvierenami, a poźniej z Malty, dzie jany kiravali vasalnaj haspadarstvam pry Hišpanskim namieśniku Sicylii.

The Genoese crossbowmen were a famous military corps of the Middle Ages, which acted both in defense of the Republic of Genoa and as a mercenary force for other Italian or European powers. Armed with crossbows, they fought both on land and in naval battles; notable cases of the latter are the battles of Meloria and Curzola.

The Varangians were Viking conquerors, traders and settlers, mostly from present-day Sweden. The Varangians settled in the territories of modern-day Belarus, Russia and Ukraine, and in the 9th century, they founded the medieval state of Kievan Rus. They also formed the Byzantine Varangian Guard, which later also included Anglo-Saxons.

The struggle against the Seljuq invaders in Georgia was led by the young King David IV of the Bagrationi royal family, who inherited the throne in 1089 at the age of 16 after the abdication of his father George II Bagrationi. Soon after coming to power, David created the regular army and peasant militia in order to be able to resist Seljuq colonization of his country. The First Crusade and the Crusaders offensive against the Seljuq Turks in Anatolia and Syria favored Davids successful campaigns in Georgia. By the end of 1099 David had stopped paying tribute to the Seljuqs and had liberated most of the Georgian lands, with the exception of Tbilisi and Hereti

The Danishmendids or Danishmends was a Turkish beylik that ruled in north-central and eastern Anatolia from 1071/1075 to 1178. The dynasty centered originally around Sivas, Tokat, and Niksar in central-northeastern Anatolia, they extended as far west as Ankara and Kastamonu for a time, and as far south as Malatya, which they captured in 1103. In early 12th century, Danishmends were rivals of the Seljuk Sultanate of Rum, which controlled much of the territory surrounding the Danishmend lands, and they fought extensively against the Crusaders.

The Pechenegs were a semi-nomadic Turkic ethnic people from Central Asia who spoke the Pecheneg language. Pecheneg mercenaries served under the Byzantines at the Battle of Manzikert. After centuries of fighting involving all their neighbours—the Byzantine Empire, Bulgaria, Kievan Rus, Khazaria, and the Magyars—the Pechenegs were annihilated as an independent force in 1091 at the Battle of Levounion by a combined Byzantine and Cuman army under Byzantine Emperor Alexios I Komnenos. Alexios I recruited the defeated Pechenegs, whom he settled in the district of Moglena into a tagma of the Moglena Pechenegs.
The Kingdom of Gwynedd was a Welsh kingdom and a Roman Empire successor state that emerged in sub-Roman Britain in the 5th century during the Anglo-Saxon settlement of Britain.
Order of Saint James of Altopascio

The Order was founded by Matilda of Canossa between 1070 and 1080 at Altopascio, a town on the Via Francigena in what is now Tuscany. Originally the Order was composed of a few canons charged with caring for pilgrims on their way to Rome or the Holy Land, via Italy, but later it extended its concern to the Way of Saint James. Their headquarters were in the church of the same name, San Giacomo dell Alto Passo.
